go_data.justification: TRADD recruits FADD/MORT1 or TRAF2 to the TNFR1 complex to initiate the signal transduction required for cell death or NF-kappaB activation.
TRADD interacts with Fas(CD95) or TNFR1 via interaction of the death domains.
TRADD is involved in signal transduction pathways initiated by TNFR1, which is a membrane receptor, implying TRADD's location in the cytoplasm.
TRADD overexpression mediates NF-kappaB activation in 293 cells.
TRADD recruits FADD/MORT1 or TRAF2 to the TNFR1 complex.
